area_name: 4- Bald Knob Cliff AKA: Lost World Crag

content.description: A hard friction testpiece that starts thin as can be and gets a little easier as you ascend. Stick clip the first bolt. Climb the thin as can be slab past 3 bolts to the first actual feature. Slight run out to the 4th bolt then follow the right trending undercling to it's conclusion. Break straight up the smooth slab for 2 more honestly spaced bolts to the final romp to the anchor on the wall above.
content.location: walking left from the stunning left angling crack there is a low roof. Lose Yourself starts at the left end of that roof.

content.description: Located on Bald Knob (southern end of the Acteon Range) in the col. on its southern end.     Find the 40' diagonal crack in a right facing wall. Steep and pumpy to 2 bolt belay. The 2nd pitch climbs up the slab past one bolt. Bold.   Rap w/2 ropes or descend a gully.

The crux is in the middle and is basically one move the rest of the climb is easy slab. This first climb wasn't a ascent it was a descent. A friend of a friend of mine has gone and bolted the beautiful friction climbs we used to top rope. These top roped climbs varied from (5-7 to 5-10). There won't be any waiting to get on a climb here.
content.location: Hike the Smarts Brook trail about 2 miles and a sort of trail can be followed westerly to the base of this furthest in dome. On this furthest dome northeast side from Route 49 is the slab that is part of the Acteon Range. Descent became the way to get up to the top of this mostly one pitch dome.

pathTokens: 4- Bald Knob Cliff AKA: Lost World Crag

content.description: This is a magical piece of rock. Tom's obscure yet classic crack is now accompanied by a gorgeous 80 ft friction test piece, Lose Yourself, and there is potential for a lot more. I only wish that the very blank vertical wall was a little less blank but I would be surprised if there is a climbable line up it.
